patient_info: Tall stature,Mitral valve prolapse,Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy,Abnormal aortic valve morphology,Mitral regurgitation,Aortic regurgitation,Tricuspid valve prolapse,Left ventricular hypertrophy,Dyspnea,Aortic root aneurysm,Kyphoscoliosis,Tachypnea,Back pain,Exercise intolerance,Tricuspid regurgitation,Heart murmur,Chest pain
golden_diagnosis: Neonatal Marfan syndrome,Marfan syndrome,马方综合征/Marfan syndrome; MFS/Marfan syndrome,马方综合征/Marfan syndrome; MFS/Marfan syndrome
predict_diagnosis:
1. Marfan syndrome
2. Ehlers-Danlos syndrome
3. Loeys-Dietz syndrome
4. Turner syndrome
5. Familial hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
6. Barlow's syndrome (mitral valve prolapse)
7. Aortic valve disease (abnormal aortic valve morphology)
8. Tricuspid valve disease (tricuspid valve prolapse)
9. Left ventricular hypertrophy syndrome
10. Thoracic outlet syndrome

Please note that these top 10 diagnoses are based on the patient's phenotype and clinical presentation. Further evaluation, including medical history, family history, and diagnostic tests, will be necessary to narrow down the final diagnosis. The listed diagnoses cover a variety of unique possibilities, but the ultimate diagnosis may vary based on the patient's specific clinical features and underlying etiology.
